edu.colorado.phet.persistence
Class CckRemotePersistence

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--edu.colorado.phet.persistence.CckRemotePersistence
All Implemented Interfaces:
PersistenceStrategy
public class CckRemotePersistence
extends java.lang.Object
implements PersistenceStrategy

A special persistence strategy for storing CCK output. A PHP script on a server is called to write the file. The URL path to where the file is to be written must be supplied by the client. The path must NOT end with '/', and the PHP script that write the file, remote-pst.php, must be present in the directory. If store() is called two or more times on an instance of this class, the file previously written by the instance is overwritten.

          Creates a persistence mechanism for storing a CCK circuit as an XML file.

Constructor Detail

CckRemotePersistence

public CckRemotePersistence(java.lang.String url,
                            java.lang.String studentID)
Creates a persistence mechanism for storing a CCK circuit as an XML file. The file is given a name generated from the specified student ID and the current date and time.

Parameters:
url - The URL path to where the file is to be stored
studentID - A unique identifier for the student submitting the file. NOte that it will be used as part of the filename, and so must not contain illegal filename characters (other than spaces, which will be replaced with '-'s).
Method Detail

store

public void store(java.lang.String text)
Writes the specified text to the file associated with this instance of CckRemotePersistence. Repeated calls to this method on the same instance of CckRemotePersistence cause the previous file to be overwritten.

Specified by:
store in interface PersistenceStrategy
Parameters:
text - The text to be written to the file
